intro: Schwenckia curviflora var. tweedyana, commonly known as Tweedy's curlyleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a distinctive wavy or curled appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
